alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Gilmer; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 11:29AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Randolph, east central Gilmer, central Lewis, eastern Braxton, Upshur and northeastern Webster Counties through noon EDT... At 1129 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holly River State Park, or 14 miles east of Sutton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor water problems could be possible. Locations impacted include... Buckhannon, Mill Creek, Holly River State Park, Rock Cave, Burnsville, Flatwoods, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Huttonsville, Alexander, Eden, Helvetia, Pickens, Cleveland, Hacker Valley, Kanawha Head, Ireland, Overhill, French Creek, Sand Run and Alton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 79 and 91. Route 33 between mile markers 15 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Gilmer; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Upshur
